intro: Artanthe tumida, commonly known as the wooly artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray, fuzzy foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Artanthe tumida is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
